title: Drawing, "Two Designs for Brooches in the "Byzantine" Style", 1860–65
medium:
Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor, graphite
Support: white paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward Brandegee, Boston
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Middle drawing in image. At left: In the center are two circles, similar to -63-56 left, connected by a rectangle.  The arch framed by a pseudo-gothic form.  At right: A similar central motif; the circles containing red crosses upon blue are framed by an angularly entwined band.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Two Designs for Brooches in the "Byzantine" Style", 1860–65.
1860–65. Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor, graphite
Support: white paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-6357.
